page.title: 06PRINCES RISBOROUGH CHURCHES
page.content: ST MARYS PARISH CHURCH Part of which date back to the 12th and 13th century, is administered by the parochial Church Council. The parish prist is chosen by the crown, subject to the approval of the bishop and church wardens. Holy comminian, family and children's Sunday School are held every Sunday. ST TERESA'S CATHORIC CHURCH This was elected in 1938. The prist lives in the Presbytery within the grounds of the church, he is helped by a parish council and both are responsible to the bishop. THE BAPTIST CHURCH Dates back to 1707 and is run by its members who elect(ardismiss) their own minister. THE METHODIST CHURCH Built in 1869, it has no resident minister.
